title: "Bigger Force Than Trump": Investor Ruchir Sharma To NDTV On AI, Tariffs
description: While US President Donald Trump's tariff wars have roiled global markets, a "bigger force than Trump" is shaping the American and world economies in the form of artificial intelligence (AI), according to global investor Ruchir Sharma.

title: A.I. Abuse Is Reinventing the Law
description: More lawyers are using artificial intelligence to write legal briefs. Some vigilantes are publicizing the A.I.-generated errors.
content:
Earlier this year, a lawyer filed a motion in a Texas bankruptcy court that cited a 1985 case called Brasher v. Stewart.
Only the case doesn’t exist. Artificial intelligence had concocted that citation, along with 31 others. A judge blasted the lawye... [4848 chars]

title: 5 Ways AI Is Reshaping YouTube Content (And How You Can Leverage It)
description: Between bans on AI content farms and new AI-powered tools like Ask Studio, YouTube content production is being transformed by artificial intelligence. Here's what this means for video marketers and creators.
content:
Artificial intelligence is having a transformative impact on every aspect of the creator economy, a market currently worth $250 billion and set to reach $528 billion by 2030.

title: JPMorgan CEO Predicts New Type of Working Week
description: Jamie Dimon predicted that advances in artificial intelligence could shorten the workweek to just three and a half days.
content:
JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon predicted that the growth of AI will lead to work weeks in the developed word shortening to three and a half days.
“It’s going to affect every application, every job, every customer interface,” Dimon said about AI at th... [2261 chars]

title: US to block Nvidia's sale of scaled-down AI chips to China
description: THE White House has informed other federal agencies that it will not permit Nvidia to sell its latest scaled-down artificial intelligence (AI) chips to China, The Information reported on Thursday, citing three people familiar with the matter.
content:

title: Is self-driving technology ready for the road?
description: AMERICAN TV series “Knight Rider” and iconic movies “Back to the Future” and “I-robot” promised self-driving cars and captivated imaginations for decades. Today, that promise inches closer to reality as vehicles equipped with an array of sensors, artificial intelligence, and lightning-fast processors navigate roads in select cities worldwide. But not all “self-driving” cars are created equal. Understanding the technology and crucial distinctions will determine the future of transportation.
content: AMERICAN TV series “Knight Rider” and iconic movies “Back to the Future” and “I-robot” promised self-driving cars and captivated imaginations for decades. Today, that promise inches closer to reality as vehicles equipped with an array of sensors, art... [5544 chars]

title: Advanced autonomous driving platform launched
description: AUTOMAKER Xpeng Motors unveiled its second-generation Vision-Language-Action (VLA 2.0) large model at the company’s 2025 AI Technology Day, called “Emergence” in its Guangzhou headquarters. The artificial intelligence (AI) run positioning the system as the computational foundation for an ambitious “Physical AI” ecosystem that extends beyond consumer vehicles to include autonomous taxis, humanoid robots, and flying cars.

title: US equity fund inflows surge to a five-week high
description: U.S. equity funds saw robust inflows in the week through November 5 as investors remained optimistic about corporate artificial intelligence-linked deals and raised purchases during a market correction.
content:

title: Elon Musk’s Ex Grimes Says AI Is 'Imminent Threat' for Children
description: Elon Musk’s ex Grimes sounded the alarm about artificial intelligence, calling it 'the biggest imminent threat' to children.
